Issues.Title: Opening Dialog Form on multi-monitor setup using HDPI PerMonitorV2 does not scale properly
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9 Preview 4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This worked in .NET 6.0

### Issue description

Opening a modal Dialog form on a 150% monitor does not scale properly and the buttons anchored to the bottom right do not anchor properly.  They are rendered underneath controls above them and are unusable.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/2184698/b60b5e9f-778c-49f2-96de-621a332c31a0

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the project on a 100% monitor.
2. Click on Edit Non-Modal and Edit Modal.  Both forms scale properly and are the same size.
3. Move the MDIParent to a 150% monitor. 
4. Click on Edit Non-Modal and the form looks OK, but the buttons overlap slightly with the controls above them.
5. Click on Edit Modal and the buttons are higher and completely under other controls making them unusable.  The form itself is also larger than the Non-Modal version.

Here is a sample project:
[DialogIssue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15745870/DialogIssue.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Opening Dialog Form on multi-monitor setup using HDPI PerMonitorV2 does not scale properly" (#11512)

### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Does not work in net6 and net8. Not tested in other net core versions. ### Issue description I have a `PropertyGrid` with a custom modal `UITypeEditor`. In this editor I use `MessageBox` with a help button. ```c# MessageBox.Show( "Click Help. You will get 2 browsers opened (instead 1 as expected).", "MessageBox", MessageBoxButtons.OK, MessageBoxIcon.Information, MessageBoxDefaultButton.Button1, 0, "https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/"); ``` When I click the Help button, I got **two** tabs with a help link opened. ### Steps to reproduce * run the project attached [MsgBoxHelpProblem.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15742690/MsgBoxHelpProblem.zip) * click the `[...]` button in the `PropertyGrid` in the `TestProp` row to run custom `UITypeEditor` * click the "Click me" button in editor * click the Help button in the `MessageBox` Expected: the single browser/tab opened with the help link Actual: *two* tabs with the help link opened. ### Additional notes: If we will add the nested editor (e.g. put another `PropertyGrid` in the `CustomForm`) and call the custom editor from this grid, then we will get the **3** tabs with a help link. So, it looks like each occurrence of the `IWindowsFormsEditorService.ShowDialog` on the stack will add the extra 1 unwanted help link tab.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multiple help links opened, when clicking the Help button in the MessageBox within UITypeEditor" (#11510)

Issues.Title: Controls docked to bottom of SplitContainer within another SplitContainer slowly shift off bottom of panel.
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64-bit) - Current
Version 17.4.3


### .NET version

.NET Framework 4.6.1

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Unknown.

### Issue description

If a horizontally split SplitContainer is placed inside another horizontally split SplitContainer and a control is anchored to the bottom when both SplitContainers have a SplitterWidth of 1, it will creep down when the form is saved in Designer mode, the designer is closed and then re-opened again. 

### Steps to reproduce

Add SplitContainer, set Orientation to Horizontal and splitterWidth to 1. Add a second SplitContainer to the top panel, set it's Orientation to Horizontal and splitterWidth to 1 as well. Add a label to the bottom panel of the second SplitContainer, Anchor it to the Bottom Right and place it in the very bottom right corner. Note the height. Save the form and open the code section. Close the designer section. Re-open the designer section and the label will have shifted down 3 pixels.
Note that it seems to be okay if the second Splitcontainer's SplitterWidth is set to 4 or higher.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Controls docked to bottom of SplitContainer within another SplitContainer slowly shift off bottom of panel." (#11507)

Issues.Title: PropertyGrid.OnPropertyValueSet: NullReferenceException
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 6

OS: WINDOWS 10.0.22631
64 bit OS and process.
Language: English
Country: Philippines

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Not sure

### Issue description

I found the following exception in the log:

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.OnPropertyValueSet(GridItem changedItem, Object oldValue)
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.CommitValue(GridEntry entry, Object value, Boolean closeDropDown)
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.CommitValue(Object value)
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.CommitText(String text)
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.Commit()
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.UnfocusSelection()
   at System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.GridViewEdit.ProcessDialogKey(Keys keyData)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PreProcessMessage(Message& msg)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PreProcessControlMessageInternal(Control target, Message& msg)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Application.ThreadContext.PreTranslateMessage(MSG& msg)

### Steps to reproduce

Issue found in log. Not sure how to reproduce.

Issues.Title: Specify a version of cmake in global.json
Issues.Body:
`latest` is not supported by Arcade, and there's no `latest` archive in the Azure blob store, so force a supported value here.

```
CommonLibrary\DownloadAndExtract : Download failed from
  https://netcorenativeassets.blob.core.windows.net/resource-packages/external/windows/cmake/cmake-latest-win64-x64.zip
  At C:\d\source-indexer\bin\repo\winforms\eng\common\native\install-tool.ps1:90 char:22
```
